Garden_Grove.West Anaheim:
West Anaheim is a district in Anaheim, California which extends from Brookhurst Street to the city limits at Cypress. West Anaheim is where most of the residential development occurred during the 1950s and the 1960s, after Disneyland opened in 1955.


== History ==
The area went by a number of names such as "Lorara", "Manchester", "Lincoln Park", "Magnolia Tree" and "WestGate" as the western gate to Los Angeles, the Los Angeles County boundary is in nearby Buena Park.
